channel.title: Home on The International Obfuscated JavaScript Code Contest
channel.description: Recent content in Home on The International Obfuscated JavaScript Code Contest

item.title: FAQ
item.description: Q: Is this related to the IOCCC? A: It’s been inspired by it, but it’s completely unrelated. Q: Who are the judges? A: Judges are yet to be announced. Q: How do I enter? A: See section How To Enter. Q: How often will the contest run? A: The contest will open roughly once per year. Watch this space for the announcement. Q: How can I contact the people behind this?

item.title: Rules
item.description: To make sure your submission will be considered, we ask you to follow these rules. Please read them carefully before submission. ยง1.0: Submissions must be complete programs Any submission which fails to execute 2 out of 3 times will be disqualified. ยง2.0: Submissions must satisfy the size requirements ยง2.1: The size of your submission must not exceed 4096 bytes ยง2.2: The number of bytes, excluding whitespace (space, tab, newline, return, formfeed) and certain control characters (;, {, }) followed by whitespace, while counting the JavaScript keywords as 1 byte, must not exceed 2048.

item.title: Size Tool
item.description: Copy your code below, and click submit. var keywords = [ 'break', 'case', 'catch', 'class', 'const', 'continue', 'debugger', 'default', 'delete', 'do', 'else', 'export', 'extends', 'finally', 'for', 'function', 'if', 'import', 'in', 'instanceof', 'new', 'return', 'super', 'switch', 'this', 'throw', 'try', 'typeof', 'var', 'void', 'while', 'with', 'yield', 'await', 'null', 'true', 'false', ]; function isSpace(c) { return c === ' ' || c === '\t' || c === '\n' || c === '\r' || c === '\f'; } function isLowercase(c) { c = c.

item.title: Winner
item.description: Contest currently ongoing. Winners will be announced after closing.
